title: A short, legal, medicinal, useful, safe, easie prescription to recover our kingdom, church, nation from their present dangerous, distractive, destructive confusion and worse than Bedlam madnesse seriously recommended to all English freemen who desire peace, safety, liberty, settlement. By William Prynne, Esq; a bencher of Lincolns-Inne.
author: Prynne, William, 1600-1669.
publicationDate: printed in the year of General Monck's invasion, 1659
notes: Caption title on p. 3 reads: A short, legal, medicinal, useful, safe, easy, prescription, &c.
Copy imperfect; leaves mutilated at head with loss of pagination.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library, Oxford.
